item.title: Supporting the goals and ideals of Military Family Month.

latestAction.text: The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.

item.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate regarding designation of the month of November as "National Military Family Month".

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S149)

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S11130; text as passed Senate: CR S11130; text of measure as introduced: CR S11120)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S11130; text as passed Senate: CR S11130; text of measure as introduced: CR S11120)

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate that the month of November 2009 should be designated National Military Family Month.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Expresses the sense of the Senate that the month of November 2009 should be designated National Military Family Month.

bill.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate regarding designation of the month of November 2009 as "National Military Family Month".

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
